findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable setSwapTokensAtAmount can trigger a huge amount of token swaps, leading to significant price volatility due to the highly volatile token price.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to `marketingWallet` and `developmentWallet` as part of the transfer flow. This address can either be a wallet address or a contract. If the address belongs to a contract then it may revert from incoming payment. As a result, the error will propagate to the token’s contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: RSR - Redundant Swap Repetition
findings.description: As part of the swap flow, the contract swaps and transfers native tokens twice. One for marketing and one for the development wallet. The repetition of the swap process increases unnecessarily the gas cost.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor. The other functions are not mutating the variables. These variables are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Non-conformance to Solidity naming conventions can lead to decreased readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code is code that is written in the contract but is never executed or reached during normal contract execution.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone. It's important to carefully test and debug assembly code to ensure that it is correct and does not contain any errors.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: The contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established if it does not check the result of the transfer methods according to the ERC20 specification.
